item.title: Rara avis (infrequent flyer)
item.description: I would love to hear (dns1@cam.ac.uk) from any other academics who have substantially reduced their flying or are keen to do so, and from anyone with information on practical alternatives to academic travel, e.g. high-quality video-conferencing. From interview in Times Higher Education, 18 June 2009 (link to full article) FORGET THE PLANE, TAKE THE TRAIN: EVERYONE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE For David Sedley, Laurence professor of ancient philosophy at the University of Cambridge, academics have been too slow to acknowledge how their actions contribute to climate change.
